citeinfo.title: Twin Cities Metropolitan Area Regional Groundwater Flow Model, Version 2.00 (Metro Model 2) Grid - Twin Cities Metropolitan Area, Minnesota

descript.abstract:
This dataset defines the portion of the Twin Cities metropolitan area regional groundwater flow model grid that is included in model computations of groundwater flow. Groundwater flow in the Twin Cities metropolitan area was modeled using the finite difference modeling code MODFLOW-96 (McDonald and Harbaugh, 1988; Harbaugh and McDonald, 1996) as implemented in the modeling package Groundwater Vistas (version 5.09 build 16) (Environmental Simulations, Inc., 2007). Using the finite-difference approximation to solve the groundwater flow equation requires the conceptual model domain to be subdivited into a set of blocks, but not all of these blocks are needed to calculate flow within the area of interest. Some grid cells, or "blocks", were therefore defined as inactive. This dataset was developed by Barr Engineering Company for the Metropolitan Council to support the development of Metro Model 2.
More information about this process is provided in the 2009 Metropolitan Council report 'Twin Cities Metropolitan Area Regional Groundwater Flow Model Version 2.00 - Technical Report in Support of the Metropolitan Area Master Water Supply Plan', which is available online at www.metrocouncil.org/environment/WaterSupply/metrogroundwatermodeldatasets.htm.
descript.purpose: The 2005 Minnesota Legislature directed the Metropolitan Council to "carry out planning activities addressing the water supply needs of the metropolitan area" (Minnesota Statutes, Section 473.1565). Specifically the Council is charged with developing a base of technical information for water supply planning decisions and to prepare a metropolitan area master water supply plan. This dataset supports this charge.
descript.supplinf: Twin Cities metropolitan area and parts of surrounding counties

place.placekey: Twin Cities, Minneapolis, St Paul, Anoka County, Carver County, Dakota County, Hennepin County, Ramsey County, Scott County, Washington County, Minnesota

theme.themekey: Metro Model 2, groundwater model, conceptual model, domain, active area

idinfo.useconst: By acceptance of this data, the user agrees to include a copy of the metadata record, including the liability disclaimer, whenever the user transmits or provides the GIS data (or any portion of it) to another user.

citeinfo.title: Datasets described by this metadata: MM2_Active.shp

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.1.1332

cntinfo.cntpos: Sr. Environmental Scientist, Water Supply Planning

attracc.attraccr: The extent indicated in this dataset was imported into Groundwater Vistas. All model cells falling outside the model extent were set as inactive.

procstep.procdesc: PROCESS: Polygon was hand digitized to include the Twin Cities metropolitan area and to extend far enough beyond that area to limit the effects of artificial boundary conditions within the area of interest. To the east, the active model area extends into Wisconsin allowing for groundwater flow into the St. Croix River from the east to be accounted for. o the northwest, the active model area extends to the edge of the Mt. Simon-Hinckley aquifer. To the west and south, the active model area extends an arbitrary amount to limit the effects of boundary conditions.

You are responsible for any consequences resulting from your use of the GIS Data or your reliance on the GIS Data. If you transmit or provide the GIS Data (or any portion of it) to another user, the GIS Data must include a copy of this disclaimer.

stdorder.ordering:
This dataset is distributed on the internet by clicking below after 'Online Linkage'. Doing so will tell your browser to download a 'ZIP' file which will contain the following:
- ArcView shape files - metadata for the dataset (.htm) - NOTICE.RTF, an important notice about this dataset that can be read by any word processing software.
This dataset can also be viewed and downloaded from the MetroGIS DataFinder Cafe at http://www.datafinder.org/cafe/ . The Cafe allows users to subset or clip datasets using an existing feature, such as a city or school district boundary or an ad-hoc, user defined area.
Additionally, this dataset is available for direct use via one or more map services. More information about what a web mapping service is can be found at http://www.datafinder.org/services/ . The specific map service and layer name for this dataset can be found by clicking the blue or green boxes under the map service column of the DataFinder Catalog at http://www.datafinder.org/catalog/ .
